definitions.definition: Having to do with discipline , or with the imposition of discipline.
examples: Debt can motivate or act as a disciplinary force for executives to achieve organizational efficiency.

definitions.definition: For the purpose of imposing punishment .
examples: The school has announced that it will take disciplinary measures against the students who participated in the protest activities.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to an academic field of study .
examples: We hope that psychologists will applaud good studies of scientific behavior and thought regardless of the disciplinary specialty of the author.

main_definition: Having to do with discipline , or with the imposition of discipline.
secondary_definitions: For the purpose of imposing punishment .
Of or relating to an academic field of study .
